attributes.comment:
Hello,

My husband and I are in the process of adopting a little girl. With the extraordinary
wait time for most adoptions, the current expiration date of 18 months for I600A
approval and fingerprinting fees are impossible to work within. We are now paying
twice for the I600A and the fingerprints. All because of something we have no
control over.

Now, the fees for both I600A and the fingerprinting are going up. It would be one
thing if the adoption could take place within the 18 months. But, the reality now is
that it's virtually impossible. With the fee increases, what used to be a total (for a
two-parent household) of $685 will now be $1660 becasue virtually no one is able
to adopt within the 18-month timeframe. I understand that fee increases must take
place, but please take into consideration the fact that the 18 months is no longer
realistic. My suggestion would be to increase the expiration time frame to one that
more realistically reflects the current adoption completion time frame.

Best regards,
Annie Smith

Comment on FR Doc # E7-01631
attributes.title: Comment Submitted by Annie Smith
